Item ID2138

A Raw chicken is an uncooked food item. Players can obtain one by killing a chicken or a rooster. Also Rufus in Canifis carries a stock of 10 and Wydin in Port Sarim carries a stock of one.

In Wydin's shop in Port Sarim there's a crate that provides unlimited raw chickens. A white apron is required to enter the room which contains the crate.

Players can turn a raw chicken into a cooked chicken by using it on a fire, a range or an ogre spit-roast. Doing so requires only level 1 cooking for the fire and the range, and grants 30 experience points. The ogre spit-roast requires level 30 cooking.

These are popular amongst new players, since any player can attempt to cook them (although players with low Cooking levels risk producing a burnt chicken). Chickens are also found around Lumbridge, and are easy to kill.

At level 34 Cooking, players stop burning chickens.

Contents

  • 1 Use in Quests
  • 2 Products
  • 3 Item sources
    • 3.1 Shop locations

Use in Quests[edit | edit source]

During Recipe for Disaster, a player needs a raw chicken to access the lair of the evil chicken. The player needs the raw chicken to access the lair even after the quest. This allows a player to fight black dragons and baby black dragons.

Raw chicken is also needed in Eadgar's Ruse – 5 chickens are needed as part of making a fake man, which is needed to fool the trolls.

Raw chicken is also needed in Druidic Ritual.

[[File:Raw chicken detail.png|left|120px]]
A '''Raw chicken''' is an uncooked food item. Players can obtain one by killing a [[chicken]] or a [[rooster]]. Also [[Rufus' Meat Emporium|Rufus]] in [[Canifis]] carries a stock of 10 and [[Wydin's Food Store|Wydin]] in [[Port Sarim]] carries a stock of one.

In Wydin's shop in Port Sarim there's a crate that provides unlimited raw chickens. A white apron is required to enter the room which contains the crate.

Players can turn a raw chicken into a [[cooked chicken]] by using it on a [[fire]], a [[range]] or an [[ogre spit-roast]]. Doing so requires only level 1 [[cooking]] for the fire and the range, and grants 30 experience points. The ogre spit-roast requires level 30 cooking.

These are popular amongst new players, since any player can attempt to cook them (although players with low Cooking levels risk producing a [[burnt chicken]]). Chickens are also found around [[Lumbridge]], and are easy to kill.

At level 34 Cooking, players stop burning chickens.

==Use in Quests==
During [[Recipe for Disaster]], a player needs a raw chicken to access the lair of the evil chicken. The player needs the raw chicken to access the lair even after the quest. This allows a player to fight [[black dragon]]s and [[baby black dragon]]s.

Raw chicken is also needed in [[Eadgar's Ruse]] – 5 chickens are needed as part of making a [[fake man]], which is needed to fool the trolls.

Raw chicken is also needed in [[Druidic Ritual]].
